subject: running swingui testrunner from ant, ant's classpath
msgSnippet: I put junit.jar and httpunit.jar under ANT s lib directory. So, I can run target test fine. I have some long test that I d rather see the progress on
messageBody:
I put junit.jar and httpunit.jar under ANT's lib directory. So, I can
run target "test" fine. I have some long test that I'd rather see the
progress on swingui.TestRunner. However, somehow ANT doesn't pass its
classpath information to java task. I didn't read enough forum post to
find similar classpath question in this forum, sorry, but I really
don't hate to set up classpath like this way.

So here are my questions
1) is there way to run swingui.TestRunner with junit task?
2) or is there some built-in variable for ANT classpath, so I can just
pass the variable, instead of setting up individual jars?

Thanks

<target name="test" >
<junit printsummary="on" fork="false" showoutput="false">
<formatter type="plain"/>
<test name="MyShortTest">
</junit>
</target>

<target name="test_with_swing">
<java fork="yes" classname="junit.swingui.TestRunner">
<classpath>
<pathelement location="c:/java/junit3.8.1/junit.jar"/>
<pathelement
location="c:/java/httpunit-1.5.4/lib/httpunit.jar"/>
</classpath>
<arg value="MyLongTest"/>
</java>
</target>
